sentences.sContent: How well do you know your chopstick etiquette?
sentences.sContent_eng: How well do you know your chopstick etiquette?
sentences.sCn: 对于这些关于筷子的礼仪，你知道多少呢？

sentences.sContent: My father progged the top of the loaves with a chopstick.
sentences.sContent_eng: My father progged the top of the loaves with a chopstick.
sentences.sCn: 我父亲用一只筷子戳刺面包的顶部

sentences.sContent: I put down my chopstick, the half eaten pork chop left cold on the plate.
sentences.sContent_eng: I put down my chopstick, the half eaten pork chop left cold on the plate.
sentences.sCn: 我放下我的筷子，被我吃了一半的排骨躺在盘子上变凉了。

trans.tranOther: one of the two thin sticks that you use to eat food in many countries in Asia
